documents.document: Next week it's #scienceweek Lots of exciting events all round the country If your down Wexford way Thursday 15th Nov you'll find me at Gorey Library talking about #memory, #dementia & #brainhealth @scienceirel @wexlibraries @ScienceWeek @OfficialWexGAA @wexfordcoco @wexfordopera https://t.co/HT3HbQrvQ9

@lhgluke @eir @eircare I switched to eir a while back - I find their @eircare absolutely appalling. Their service is pretty crap to - the signal keeps dropping in my house something that never happened with any other provider I've ever had

@GraceMcGettigan its appalling that @pressec shared an edited version of the video and that they revoked his pass. I think all Whitehouse staff should return their press passes in #solidarity with @Acosta Leave @realDonaldTrump talking to himself

I urge Whitehouse press to return your press passes & leave @realDonaldTrump talk to himself until he reinstates @Acosta's pass We need more tough questions not less It's alarming that the #Whitehouse has withdrawn @Acosta's pass & shared edited video #solidarity #freepress https://t.co/MNsdRGOBB1

@gavreilly @PolymathBGD it's really an alarming turn of events - it must stop - I think all Whitehouse press should return their press passes in solidarity until @Acosta's pass is reinstated & Whitehouse retract their statement re him assaulting the woman - the full video is clear
@cathalodonnell @MichRogCook excellent idea - I may just get writing myself

@cathalodonnell @MichRogCook I'm always wary of commenting about such cases when I'm not in possession of the full facts or was not present in court. But the SC's words are reported as a direct quote & irrespective of the facts of the case her comments are appealing

@conor_pope I've had similar incidences of outright rudeness and even aggression on my doorstep from'representatives' of both companies & a charity. I complained in one case not sure it achieved anything but it's surreal to be abused at your own front door for asking legitimate questions

@roisiningle Implying that wearing a thong with a lace front is something that is relevant in a rape case is not a client's instruction it's propagating a damaging & dangerous rhetoric that suggests that a woman's underwear is somehow a sign of consent. It's regressive & frankly disgusts me.
@Vallmeister The rude guy telling the polite guy he's rude - madness
RT @Vallmeister: This is absolutely wild https://t.co/HrdglKDadQ

Oh dear https://t.co/kzoQe1VAUt

@samwindrim @louiseckenny @campaignforleo no and neither are the doctors - the incidence of suicide among them is appalling - they work crazy hours all year round - we need more doctors and less admin and management - we also need to use MRIs & have outpatient clinics at weekends with proper staff of course
@galvindm @maryniloc @campaignforleo @SimonHarrisTD I would also argue that ridiculous, unhealthy working hours are also an issue

@lynbw @deshocks It's not just homework that can kick off a cascade of lifelong effects Kids love to learn it is how we adapt & grow, we are born inquisitive Unfortunately the 'school' system takes the joy out of learning & fails to acknowledge diversity
RT @HachetteIre: Your favourite vet will be on @IrelandAMVMT this morning. @ProfNoelFitz will be speaking about his new book #ListeningToThâ€¦

@lynbw @deshocks I don't disagree with you about the bigger issue of homework I agree that playing & reading together are better I wasn't suggesting one instead of the other But kids get homework & so setting good habits & preferably making it enjoyable should set them up for the future at school
@deshocks 2. also its an important interaction that will give you insights into your child's developmental progress - the earlier you identify any issues such as a dyslexia the better

@deshocks 1. One other thing that jumped out at me was the advice not to prioritise doing homework because the child is only 5. I disagree, build good habits from the outset, otherwise you are setting up future problems Tts an opportunity to have time together make it enjoyable not a chore
@ShaneBeattyNews Yup me too thatâ€™s why I felt I needed more and then I began doubting Iâ€™d even watched last season ðŸ˜‚

@ShaneBeattyNews you know that's funny I've tried to start watching it 3 times and given up each time - I'd been blaming it on feeling I needed a recap of what happened last season but I think maybe I'm just not bothered
Beatrice is a strong clever woman - but be warned she encounters some very brutal and scary stuff from the imagination of the master of horror @GrahamMasterton https://t.co/zrd2EccTj0

@Pidgejen @LurieChildrens Well done

@janeruffino @GaryDunne As I said I read your tweet & sensed & recognised your despair I tried to offer some hope How you interpret that is your prerogative but please donâ€™t say Iâ€™m peddling or yelling I was trying to be kind nothing more. I wish you well & hope the right door opens for you one day soon

@janeruffino @GaryDunne Are you serious? I was trying to give you hope if you read my tweet. Iâ€™m guessing by your profile pic that Iâ€™m a lot older than you Iâ€™m 56 and just got my break so I do know what trying for a very long time is like. But if you want to adopt that attitude thatâ€™s your prerogative.

@janeruffino @GaryDunne I thought the exact same Jane but a chance meeting with a very kind author changed that. He introduced me to a literary agent My 1st book will be published on March 7th by Orion Spring. Iâ€™m already writing my 2nd ðŸ“š Never give up hope and always be ready to follow your dream

@nbgbgb if you focus on the here and now you can still enjoy life, I laughed and sang with my mum till the end - she'd muddle up the lyrics but it didn't matter the focus was on the fun

With dementia it is so important to see the person not the disease. Imagine if you only saw the tumour & ignored the person with cancer Focus on preserved abilities rather than the losses. Imagine if you focused only on a removed breast & ignored the rest of the person https://t.co/Ov6dSv2aFB
Check this out Galway today and lots of other locations over the next week - a fantastic initiative to give people a sense of what people with MS experience https://t.co/D4uNIhrRCs
This is an example of why I love @Twitter https://t.co/6RQiTpTbH4

Fantastic - I travel a lot and have never seen them I always purchase the well-priced DAA water bottles - I shall be flying twice this month and will endeavour to find them - thank you https://t.co/6RQiTpTbH4

I'd like to see water fountains in airports too so you can bring an empty reusable bottle through security and then fill with water in the terminal without having to purchase a plastic bottle of water Any chance of this happening @DublinAirport @DublinAirportT2 https://t.co/t9D5rOustD

@daithigor Melt 1tbs butter in a mug in microwave Beat in one egg with a fork Mix in 3tbs of almond flour (ground almonds) Mix in 1/2 teaspoon baking powder Microwave for 90 sec Tip out of mug, slice then toast on both sides Butter and top with chopped berries ðŸ“ðŸ“ðŸ“
Homemade low-carb toast made with almond flour and fresh berries instead of jam. Only takes 5 minutes to make from scratch. Yum. #healthybreakfast https://t.co/niL4yj5BvM

@judydei @dementiaireland There needs to be more awareness among families and indeed health professionals of the distinction between delirium and dementia - and don't get me started on decisions made 'in the best interests of the patient'!!!

Does anyone else 'lose it' with #Alexa or is it just me? She frequently gives me the deaf ear & ignores my requests. @Caljoe3 @chrisrdonoghue @ShaneBeattyNews @irishaid This is not to get LGBT attention - this is to protect the human rights of LGBT people - if you read my tweets earlier in this thread you will see I already discussed the issue of balance https://t.co/qalQawCMIm

@Caljoe3 @chrisrdonoghue @ShaneBeattyNews @irishaid The primary target is where need is identified ie health & education Tanzania's plans to round up & imprison LGBT people for up to 30 years were only announced this week This is a human rights issue & a new need. We should help Violence against LGBT has risen under this president
@GrainneBlair Sorry to hear you are not well Grainne - get well soon. https://t.co/uolJaUvvDV

@canisgallicus @gav4sax @mickymcglynn @Anuna_Choir @RTElyricfm @artscouncil_ie @XHNews @ChinaDaily @PDChina @ftchina @CDT @chinaorgcn @TourismIreland Very proud - They did a tour of China this time last year and have been invited back for this performance which will be televised to a potential audience of about 600 million I believe - They are also much loved in Japan

@canisgallicus @BBC @bbcthree @zerowasteeurope @AnneBuckley38 @JMcGuinnessTD @TourismIreland @jack @campaignforkate @BrigidLaffan @austinoc_austin @ProfJohnCrown @LaceyDermot I agree Michelle - my understanding is supermarkets became afraid of being sued if they gave the food away. I also think that best before/use by dates are a bit of a scam that lead to wastefulness - when we were kids sacks of potatoes lasted months

@chrisrdonoghue @ShaneBeattyNews @irishaid I don't think anyone is questioning the value of Irish aid nor would we want those in need to suffer but we cannot stand by while this happens to LGBT people - surely the aid that we give puts us in a position that might allow us to take acton to protect LGBT people

@Twitspice @LABirdlady @ProudResister I do think this does a disservice to people who are mentally ill and retain their morals and ethics - Trump is an abomination - It terrifies me that he seems to have complete free reign to spout his hatred and ignore human rights

@ShaneBeattyNews I've just shared a screen shot with you from the 2017 report

@ShaneBeattyNews from the report - its a moral question isn't it finding a balance between helping to eradicate poverty, helping individuals and propping up regimes with anti-LGBT or anti-human rights agendas https://t.co/ehM6hC1cMe
@ShaneBeattyNews Here's a report from 2017 I haven't read it myself but it says it gives breakdown https://t.co/ztAYJjm1ea
@ShaneBeattyNews sounds like a lot - might be a cumulative amount in aid over time - let me know what you find
@barbarascully @JulietteGash indeed - and we have needed it for our sons too
@ShaneBeattyNews Shane - horrific practices, breaks my heart completely - do you have a link to more info on the 26million
@barbarascully @JulietteGash its very expensive but we have always seen it as a basic bill like electricity that has to be paid even if it means no holidays, socialising etc.

@MichRogCook @roisiningle I've worked with primary school kids promoting brain health Among other things managing stress is vital for brain health as chronic stress impacts negatively on brain structure & function & future stress response Teachers told me many pupils are displaying signs of chronic stress
RT @TCDdeanresearch: Fascinating graph on average walking speed and social class presented by @LayteRichard at the health inequalities andâ€¦

@roisiningle Ah that's great. She sounds amazing. I do think it's wonderful that they have student councils in primary schools now - we had nothing like that in fact I recall teachers criticising me for being outspoken - same when my kids spoke out or questioned 'norms' so glad its changing

@roisiningle There is indeed. I admire the 9 year old girl but can you imagine how difficult / impossible it would be for a 9 year old boy to lead something similar. It would be lovely and so inclusive if the 9yr old girlâ€™s campaign was gender neutral.

@roisiningle Yes I agree about girls & trousers but I would love if we could get to a point where children irrespective of gender can choose to wear skirts or trousers as their uniform. Sounds scary but gendered clothing is as questionable as gendered colours, toys, jobs.
